Reviews.Title: Plot watcher pro is big improvement
Reviews.Author: S. Butler
Reviews.Content: The pro is a good product. I have a lot of infrared game cameras, but I bought this to observe large food plots. A deer has to cross within 30 feet or so of an infrared camera but the pro takes a shot of entire plot every 5 seconds so you pick up deer in the whole plot. The battery life on the pro is great. It's been out 6 weeks on daytime only every 5 seconds and battery meter shows about 55%.I have a 32GB sd card that will hold at least 3 weeks of images. It takes about 7 minutes per day to watch the video on 5x speed looking for deer, so it takes a while to review a few weeks of data. But it sure has told me a lot of good info. Image quality is good and the software has a zoom feature.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: D. Stux "stooxie"
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything it claims to do, and does it well. I don't need an infra-red trigger camera to tell me when a 10 point buck is out at 3 am. I need a camera to watch the places I hunt and tell me when the deer are there during daylight, dawn and dusk. The interface is really easy to use, the "GameFinder" software works surprisingly well (both Mac and PC) and the device works with very large SDHC cards. I am using a 32GB class 10 and so far so good. I could easily have 3 or 4 of these set up around the backyards that I hunt to let me know when and where I need to be.UPDATEThis camera has already prove itself invaluable! I tied it to a tree facing an area that supposedly had deer "all the time" according to the residents. Well, they are, but not at the time I would have thought. The camera showed that at 2:38pm, on the nose, almost daily 4-5 deer walked by and grazed. Brilliant, I am getting a second one of these.

Reviews.Title: Owner of original plot watcher...
Reviews.Author: justinsmomma
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with the battery life of the original plot watcher, but loved the concept. When the plot watcher pro came out with a stated 4 month battery life we thought it was definitely worth a try.  It takes awesome pics and has fantastic battery life (after 1 week the battery life was still at 86%). We are fully satisfied and excited about this product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Game Camera
Reviews.Author: Bluelight511
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2E2E2U3X88TOC', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2E2E2U3X88TOCloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } // ]]> var cv_mo2E2E2U3X88TOCRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo2E2E2U3X88TOCRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91jSQIhkG1S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo2E2E2U3X88TOCpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo2E2E2U3X88TOCpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91jSQIhkG1S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2E2E2U3X88TOCcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2E2E2U3X88TOCcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:05 MinsThis camera proved itself the first day in the field. I hunt public hunting lands and can not bait deer. I see alot of buck tracks but can never seem to guess the right spot for my trail cameras. I can't put them directly on the trails because of thieves. After one of my trail camers was stolen last week, I decided to give "Day 6 Plotwatcher Pro HD" a try. Five hours after putting out my Plotwatcher Pro, I had a little 4 point buck walking around the area. He returned 4 hours later at sunset and walked around for 10 minutes. I would have never seen him on my trail cameras. I have 2 trail cameras for sale if anyone wants them. I'm going with all 'Day 6 Plotwatcher Pro HD".

Reviews.Title: Plotwatcher Pro
Reviews.Author: surpie1940
Reviews.Content: I purchased Plotwatcher Pro to catch scrap metal thieves that operate with impunity in my state(Miss.)It is great product and the beauty is in the software "bells and whistles" that allow me to capture the images of the thieves and their auto tag numbers to at least force reluctant-to-act law officers and/or sometimes complicit-in-crime  law officials with  jpeg images of the thieves. A Plotwatcher Pro is the cat's meow and the best "gumshoe" money can buy... and they cannot be bribed to lie.I'm waiting for an IR model for the deep-in-the-woods surveillance.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for what its intended
Reviews.Author: Tams
Reviews.Content: This camera is for hunters.  Not for taking pictures of wildlife.  The resolution is not on par with your Iphone as one person suggested...but try fitting a picture taken every second , 12 hours a day, for several weeks on your phone.  Several 1 star ratings completely missed the point of this camera let me highlight the upsides....1) Its the only camera I found that will take constant pictures regardless of motion trigger.  There is no motion capture so you get picture coverage as wide as a football field and just as deep.  You will see everything in that view, and things closer up you will get pretty good pics.  The reviewer that was annoyed that you could not tell between a buck and a doe was referring to pics that are a good distance away.  Other motion triggered cams would never even picked it up in the first place.2) Doubles as a security camera.  Can be used as a security cam during the off season.  I have had a decoy stolen so I was just as concerned about capturing thieves and trespassersWith pics at a rate up to 1 a second there is no way you will miss any action.  There is something that makes me feel better when  I have confirmed video that no one has been bothering the hunting site.3) Battery life is incredible!  I have used this camera for two months at a time and it still had 60% battery life.  I am away from the property for weeks at a time so this is a must.  And only 8 AA batteries.  No lugging around one of those ridiculous huge batteries that other cams require.4) Software does work well for detecting movement.  Very simple to use. Without this it would take hours to go through a week of footage.5) Simple to use.  The only thing you need the lcd screen is for setting up the shot.Cons or improvements:1) Camera needs to be set up in a proper location.  I recommend trying a few spots prior to hunting season.  The sunrise or sunset, along with wind blowing leaves can drastically effect the search of the sofware for movement.  You will know what I mean after trying different places.  This can be minimized by good placement. Dont put it in line with the sunrise or sunset.  A better lens  filter, liked a polarized lens might improve it.2) LCD does not preview images except for setting up.  It would have been nice to review the pics while I was hunting.  An android ap with software would be awesome so you could swap the cards and review out in the field.  Without a motion capture ap you would need to sort through a crazy amount of pics.3) No night mode, not good at low light pics.  It is what it is.  I don't care what the deer are doing at night.  This could be a must for people looking for Yeti...4) Price is high at $200+.  But hunting is not something most people do to save money.  I have not seen any other camera that does what this cam does for the same money though....

Reviews.Title: Unbelievabe Camera
Reviews.Author: FatFatallThat
Reviews.Content: I ordered 1 of these Camera in October and Another in November. They are unbelievably Consistent. They have been running every day since purchased. They have even been running on the same sets of batteries since put out and we are now in January. I have them set up on 2 130yd long Shooting lanes. Clarity past 30 yds is a little tough to tell exact Rack size and past that you cant, but you can definitely tell deer crossing and feeding. It gave me a Much better idea where to set up my Motion Cameras and to do alot more mid day hunts at times I would of never thought. It even helped me catch some kids hunting on my land when I wasn't around.  And I am in South Louisiana Where it is very very wet and gave no problems with moisture, camera failure or anything. Fantastic Cameras is all I can say.

Reviews.Title: Very good product, but not great.
Reviews.Author: Donna Brongiel
Reviews.Content: Plotwatcher is the right name.  The camera is great for patterning activity in your hunting area.  I bought 3 cameras and have move them twice and recorded the equivalent 50 days of activity.  First the con's --- by a country mile the biggest issue is that the image quality is very low resolution so gauging any detail beyond 20 yards is impossible (e.g. Counting tines on a deer rack; seeing the beard on a turkey); saving individual images via computer software.  The pro's --- battery life with regular energizer batteries is awesome; the range or FOV is easily 150 yards long and 75 yards wide; the factory default settings are perfect (5sec picture intervals; auto dusk/dawn activation); 16gb memory card with 5sec pic intervals will last you 10 days; quality product; adjusting setting is very easy.Accessories to consider --- camlock security box (it fits perfectly and protects camera from the elements); masterlock Cable to safely secure to the tree;  climbing tree sticks to get the camera a good 15 feet off the ground so you can pattern activity in a much larger area

Reviews.Title: Plotwatcher Pro has a quality issue with LCD screen
Reviews.Author: Leonard Gamberg
Reviews.Content: I have a Plotwatcher pro that i bought last October (2012).  Overall the camera is average.  The picture/ video quality is very poor so anything over 30 yards it becomes difficult to tell any details.  It works well for monitoring an area to note deer travel.  I have had my plotwatcher for 10 months, after being out for 1 week this year the LCD screen went white and stopped working.  I contacted Plotwatcher about a warranty repair but am out of luck as I no longer have my receipt.  The CS rep stated that this has been a problem with this camera and in fact they are back logged on repairs waiting for new LCD screens to come in to repair what has already been sent back and that he has a list of people to contact to send in their cameras once they have screens in stock.  My repair will cost $50.00 as I can't find my receipt 10 months later.  In my opinion poor customer service for a known issue with a product.  There are better options for the money with trailcams that take video at a much higher resolution and that also stand behind their warranty.

Reviews.Title: Buyer's remorse
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Similar to the other reviewer, the custom time based recording does not work.  Also, if it records a large file (which happens at least once a day) the playback video freezes halfway through and only shows large grey blocks on the monitor.  I tried experimenting with other 'custom' functions and the result is the camera does not record at all. I tried contacting the manufacturer and never got a response.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic new tool for the deer hunter
Reviews.Author: Gumboman
Reviews.Content: I own two Plotwatcher Pro camera's. They make a great addition to my triggered cameras and I use them in an entirely different way. Either on food plots, open pastures or in woodland travel area's to record day time activity. These camera's will record photo's that triggered camera's will never get. Here are some unique videos I have recorded that would have been completely missed by a triggered camera.Six racked bucks walking single file at more than 60 feet distance. Group of bucks walking across a pasture more than 80 feet. Twenty four deer feeding on pea patch at a distance where a triggered camera would have never been fired. Camera set up on trail and recording buck movement 20 or more yards off the trail. Again triggered camera would have missed this. Countless times I have video of deer in food plots and in woodlands recording deer movement that would have been missed by any and all triggered cameras. If this camera could record night time video it would obsolete all triggered camera's on the market. As of now triggered camera's still have a place due to their night time capability, but every hunter should have one of these Plotwatchers in his arsenal.

Reviews.Title: Mac Gamefinder software
Reviews.Author: Edward Beranek
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera.  Used a 32GB card with it and set it up for dawn to dusk recording with a picture interval set to 2 sec.The batteries last about 5-6 weeks with the picture interval set to 1 picture/sec, or 1 picture every 2 seconds. The files it would record came in at over 2.4GB per day in most instances.The Macintosh Gamefinder software would load and play any file that was sized less than 2.4GB.  Any file above this sizewould place a tiny dot in the upper left corner of the Gamefinders window.  That would be all it would show.Moving the files to a windows computer allowed the time lapse movies to play.  So if you have a Macintosh andwish to record at faster intervals, you will have a problem.  I'd contacted Day6 about this, and they claimed it had been fixed.Their downloads/support page indicates that the software for the Macintosh is at version 1.5.  However, when you perform a get infoon the application, it indicates it's at version 1.0.  The date stamp is Sept 6, 2011, but it's hard to figure if that means they updatedthe app to version 1.5, and forgot to update the version being reported to get info.  Perhaps a link at their web site is queueing the older softwarefor download.  They were responsive the first couple of times I'd contacted them, but have ignored my further efforts to contact them.  It might be that thissituation does not occur often enough to expend the effort to fix the mac gamefinder software to display files larger than 2.4GB.I was using this camera for surveillance and it was useful in catching people driving onto our property, but the higher capture rate wasneeded due to how fast thieves work.  For most purposes this is one of the best systems I've used.  But if you only have access to a Macintosh, then keep the pictures  being captured to onceevery 5 seconds or more.  That should keep the file size under 2.4GB where displaying the pictures breaks the Gamefinder app.  Or find a windowscomputer to view them with.  I would also recommend the optional zoom lens.  This provides for more places to conceal the device than just having the standard lensavailable would allow.  Changing between either lens is simple and quick.  Overall, I think this is a very good system, but I'm dinging them one star for their mac support.

Reviews.Title: Very limited use
Reviews.Author: Connie Paris
Reviews.Content: This is the third and most expensive trail camera I've had, and most definitely the most disappointing. The video is too grainy to differentiate doves from quail or rabbits from debris blowing by. And no night video? Even as a security camera, too grainy to identify anyone. Dont waste your money. Going back to the $80 one, excellent quality photos and at night too!

Reviews.Title: This is great
Reviews.Author: Sparklehal
Reviews.Content: This is a great product. It works just as described.  If you do not buy it directly from Day Six, please go download the update.  It makes a world of difference.  The video will play fine for a while but will seem to freeze up, the update solves that problem.  It has worked well even in the dark, of course it is not the same quality as daylight but it suited our purpose.  We will not have it out watching our food plot.  Thank you Day Six.

Reviews.Title: great, but not exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: It does what it says, but it doesn't show details of the animals, which is what I wanted it for.

Reviews.Title: Beware of time based recording
Reviews.Author: howie505
Reviews.Content: When it does work, the picture is clear and the software is easy to use. It does have an external power source so if you are using it for security you do not have to rely on batteries. However, my experience with the custom settings was quite disappointing. I followed the instruction manual and programmed the camera to record at night for security monitoring of my driveway. According to the instructions, you can customize the time it records to conserve battery life so I asked it to turn on at 11pm and off at 6 am. Frustration and disappointment resulted as it never recorded a single image in the 6 weeks it was turned on. The burglars won again and I learned the hard way that this camera only records if you set it "always on". Do not rely on the time based setting.

Reviews.Title: Great product for general surveillance applications
Reviews.Author: cyclistman "cyclistman"
Reviews.Content: I've owned the Day 6 Plotwatcher Pro HD and GameFinder software for about 6 months now. The package works well for general surveillance applications. Equipped with a 32 GB SDHC memory card, the device will run from dawn to dusk for many days using a 5-second interval. The memory card transfers easily from camera to laptop; the software has met my expectations. This is a much better option than a motion-triggered videocam for my application.

Reviews.Title: Best product
Reviews.Author: ROBERT PAOLINI
Reviews.Content: I don't thave enough time to say just how much time I saved by using these cameras. They work well and the batteries last a long time. I know where the deer come from and whee they go and what times they like to travel thanks to these great cameras.

Reviews.Title: be an informed buyer
Reviews.Author: bikehike
Reviews.Content: Good battery life as stated.  Can find movement in the area the camera is covering.  Picture quality is poor - explained on the day6 website, but not on the item description.

Reviews.Title: Cannot wait for upgraded version
Reviews.Author: Donald R. Elpers
Reviews.Content: It's great to be able to see what is moving out and around at 100 yards plus during the day, which comes in very handy for travel routes on a daily basis.  I hope in the near future Day6 Outdoors comes up with a way for night viewing maybe like a black flash at night for as long of a range as possible.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Catherine Edmondson
Reviews.Content: Great for a food plot......sun and rain  cause blurry pics. Wish it could allow snap shots to be saved from the daily files.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: elkhunterDB
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best scouting tools to come along yet. Works great watching any food plot for turkey or deer activity during daylight hours. Outstanding battery life with lithium AA's. Will be purchasing another before spring turkey season.

Reviews.Title: Great Investment
Reviews.Author: PA Hunter
Reviews.Content: I hunt turkeys that often come out into a field near where I hunt.  I live about 45 minutes from my hunting spot and can't get there every day to scout.  This tool has shown me when and where the turkeys come to the field.  I have run it for 3 weeks and still have about 60% battery life.  If you need to scout large areas during the daytime I would say you can't afford not to have this camera.

Reviews.Title: Best Game Camera
Reviews.Author: Seth
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFB', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; swfParams.sessionId = "000-0000000-0000000"; swfParams.marketplaceID = "ATVPDKIKX0DER"; swfParams.salign = "LT"; swfParams.preset = "detail"; swfParams.mediaObjectId = "m33CMQMYRRN6AY"; swfParams.autoPlayTimer = ""; swfParams.xmlUrl = "http://www.amazon.com/gp/mpd/getplaylist-v2/m33CMQMYRRN6AY/000-0000000-0000000"; swfParams.amazonServer = "www.amazon.com"; swfParams.scale = "noscale"; flashParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; } swfParams.xmlUrl = "http://www.amazon.com/gp/mpd/getplaylist-v2/" + movieID + "/000-0000000-0000000"; flashParams.wmode = "transparent"; swfParams.autoPlay = "1"; } if (document.getElementById('cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBduration')) { document.getElementById('cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBduration').style.display='none'; } cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91lBawBibuS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBpreplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBpreplayImageId'); if (cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBpreplay) { cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBpreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91lBawBibuS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91lBawBibuS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1RGLBQ9FBYWFBcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:09 MinsBought this game camera so I could figure out which way the deer were coming from. Now I know and I'd have to say that this is probably the best day light game camera out there. Love how the software plays all the photos like a movie clip for each day. Definitely would recommend this camera to anyone! When using 8 AA batteries you can/could leave the camera out for months, but you'll most likely be so anxious to see what pictures it took within the first week.ha Don't hesitate on this camera if you want a really good day time camera. It does the job very well, a lot better than the first model.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Dratliff
Reviews.Content: This product is the best I have ever had for watching game and keeping an eye on the property!!!  I am sure to get a second one.

Reviews.Title: likes & dislikes on Pro HD
Reviews.Author: hobo
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Improvement over the 2011 version (a great camera) on menu selection, ease of programming, SD card instead of USB & long batt life.  SD card can be viewed in the field by separate viewer - nice.Cons:  Strap to fasten to a tree/post etc is shiney BLACK - attracts attention of other hunters (possible theft).  No other support method can be used except the strap , so user may need to provide a post if tree is not avail.  Any change of angle from that of the tree used must be made by stuffing limbs, straw, etc behind camera to get the needed angle. No method to verify field of view camera is recording, it's all guesswork by the person setting the camerea up and wondering what is in view.  Poor design by mfg as no alternate method is avail to hold camera and sight check on field of view.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: DRS "Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: I set the camera up to watch my house being built.  Put some good batteries in it and a 32gb sd .  Set the interval at 5 seconds during daylight and it has been working perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: MarkInStL
Reviews.Content: I own 4 different game cameras and this camera by far is the easiest and most reliable to use. Very simple to setup, and it just works! It is a good feeling knowing that this camera is 100% dependable. The battery life is excellent. I personally use the iGo Green AA alkaline rechargeable batteries and can get a month out of them taking pictures every 5 seconds during daylight hours. Just be sure to recharge those particular batteries before they hit 50% depleted otherwise you'll degrade their lifespan very quickly.The other brands of cameras I own are infrared night cameras which take video, but many times they wear the batteries down way too quickly and occasionally I end up with corrupt memory cards. With this camera, you can't go wrong assuming you don't need night vision video.

Reviews.Title: Zero Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Joe Wats
Reviews.Content: I would have some good things to say about this system and was about to buy 5 more with a friend of mine.  However, it stopped working.  I have tried to email Day 6 and called Day 6 over and over.  Never got anything but leave a message no matter what department I went to.  Not  a single reply by phone or email.  This is not just terrible customer service, it is no customer service.  Consider the thing disposable!

Reviews.Title: It's a Plot Watcher, not Rack Watcher
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Corkery
Reviews.Content: This product delivers what it advertises. I've seen reviews complain they can't see enough detail of distant deer. Deer that a regular trail cam would never have recorded at all. Also, that it doesn't work at night. Again: PlotWatcher never claimed to do this.It will confirm deer movement (or lack of movement) and record the time and direction of that movement. It's there when you can't be. It's better for open fields but helps in wooded settings too.An improvement would be a short removable cord for a cell phone to aid in aiming, but its not a big deal. Our group will be buying more.

Reviews.Title: Day 6 Plotwatcher Pro
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Morton
Reviews.Content: I have not used yet.  It looks like it will be easy to set up.  Looking forward to setting it up and seeing how far it will reach.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised.
Reviews.Author: D. L Shoup "Middle Aged Music Fan"
Reviews.Content: I like the internal trigger mechanism that takes a photo every 5 seconds.  Nothing is missed during daylight hours.  I just wish that it took night photos.  My night camera that takes photos when the motion detector triggers it, does not give me as good a coverage as the Day 6 does.

Reviews.Title: as advertized
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Cox
Reviews.Content: Bought my Plotwatcher Pro for Home surveillance, has worked flawlessly for over a year with good battery life and takesexcellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Plotwatcher Pro
Reviews.Author: Don Clark
Reviews.Content: Nice addition to your trail cameras. Great on batteries. This camera only works during daylight hours. The only negative I can think of it does not work in the dark. Still highly recommend. Great for viewing wildlife and keeping tabs on your property.

Reviews.Title: Crashed and burned!
Reviews.Author: Dwayne
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't you know it I used this devise about 4 or 5 times and it failed. Just 1 month after warranty was up. This is an expensive camera I paid over $200 for it and expected it to last way longer. The display had streaks and washed out as other review also stated. I thought well maybe it will still record but no such luck. When I called tech support they said send it in an we will fix it for about 1/2 the price of a new one! Do not buy they are having issues and you can almost buy 2 of other good brands for the price. I had purchased a steel lock box for this camera also which is now useless to me. Out a lot of money not happy! Just decided to cut my losses and let everyone know not to make the same mistake!

Reviews.Title: No night shots, but really clear daytime pics.
Reviews.Author: Sue Schaefer "GetSet"
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and use. Battery life is as advertised, if you use lithium in cold weather. The software that comes with it for viewing has a pretty primitive-looking GUI, but is very functional. I like the feature of letting it scan through hundreds of photos for something that appears to be wildlife (or a vehicle, or people). That saves a lot of time. Love just watching the time-lapse of a day on the farm, even if no wildlife came through.Next camera will have IR for night shots, when animals are really moving around. Also would like to be able to view, remotely, but that's a whole other ballgame.Great camera for the price. Nice clear pictures. Various settings make it adaptable to your needs.

Reviews.Title: Returned
Reviews.Author: Ami M LeFebvre
Reviews.Content: Harder to use than it says, also have heard pics turn out grainy unless you get the lens ad ons

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: David Smith
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality, easy to use.  Manufacture should ship it w/ a SD card so the unit could be used right out of the box.  For some reason I missed the fact it doesn't work in the dark - unit needs light.

Reviews.Title: Great Tool for hunting
Reviews.Author: Mr. Andre Kaniuk
Reviews.Content: This thing has been fantastic.  Clear pictures, the software is easy to use, battery life is fantastic.  Great buy.  I'm thinking about getting a second one..

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: matt brian
Reviews.Content: Works great and battery life is much improved . Would recommend. Don't mind not having pics at night. Can't hunt then anyway

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: tom davis
Reviews.Content: great super duper camera for home security.. and to set in my wood shop and take pictures of me working

Reviews.Title: Does what the manufacture states!
Reviews.Author: Ed Banko
Reviews.Content: I like how long the battery lasts and it gives you an idea of the deer movement during the daytime hours. It does not take nighttime pictures but this is not why I bought it. Pictures are a little grainy close to dusk and dawn but you can make out the deer.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: joseph s. baker
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera and software temp and moon phases are always wrong on both of my cameras but everything else works great!

Reviews.Title: does pretty good
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: does good. Hard to see what type deer at distant. Cannot see the display at times. Just some of the words can be seen. Sun and shadows make it hard to see picture on computer.

Reviews.Title: Great tool
Reviews.Author: Myron
Reviews.Content: It is like sitting in your spot sun-up till sundown to scout, I hunt very thick cover,so I have to scan a little slower,but I can scan a 12 hr. day in 15 minutes. I see deer in back ground a regular trail cam would never pick up. This cam covers shooting hours which is all I care about, I don't care what comes through at midnight. Makes sitting in your spot easier as now you have confidence in your choice of spots.

Reviews.Title: plotwatcher pro likes and dislikes
Reviews.Author: nomrbr
Reviews.Content: likes, easy read screen, easy setup for viewing times,my plotwatcher is set up to record video at one second inter/camera on a 645a an off a 10a. backon at 2pm and off at 7 pm/////// battery ran for a full 3 weeks until had to be changed out.//////////////////////////////////////////////dislikes, if camera videos buck that is walking  10 or more yard away with his  nose to ground or head up its hard to tell size of rack yet alone amount of points and rack size, deer come in very blurry, their is no way to focus the subject, viewing screen fades in and out when battery power get low. checked rating before purchase,,,,apparently it wasn't tested in the field.

Reviews.Title: Great Game Cam
Reviews.Author: Kevin Sliger
Reviews.Content: Takes lots of great pics. Battery life is awesome. I got the camlock box to match it is sturdy. I use a python cable as well.

Reviews.Title: Great scouting tool!
Reviews.Author: Tucker
Reviews.Content: This is a great tool to use in the field to see where the deer & turkeys are coming from & going to! I can see shapes of animals out to 150 to 200 yards, but I can not see very good detail when zooming in with the software.  Wish it had more pixels for zooming quality, but aside from that, I am very pleased with the quality & features that this camera offers.

Reviews.Title: overall ok
Reviews.Author: dennis merrill
Reviews.Content: like the unit but takes long time to replay  if I use 3x its too fast and i miss critters

Reviews.Title: Plot watcher pro
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I have 3 of these that I run at my hunting property year round, they work very well for mule deer because they often do not walk on a narrow trail. I put them 12' high in cottonwoods where they can film the entire riverbottom, the height also deters vandals. These are very well designed and built, the only shortcoming is they don't work at night. The 32 gb card will fill up in about 3-5 weeks depending on the time of year, to bad they didn't design them for a 64 gb card. Battery life is very good, they average about 3 months unless it's below zero for a couple of weeks. Overall these are great tools for seeing what's on your property and what time of day they move and where. I've learned a lot about my hunting lease in the last couple years with these cameras, I would never be without them now.Kb

Reviews.Title: Works fine after fiding out that the software version sent with camera was not latest and had a glitch
Reviews.Author: Dale Newton
Reviews.Content: Camera was shipped with vs. 1.4 PlotWatcher software. When I reviewed the first two days of "video," the playback was faulty, showing a greay area and the time date stamps, etc disapearred. On the second day,the video actually froze while playing back. I had the camera set to take a pic every 2 seconds. (Trying to catch a thief....which we did!) Aftrer calling Day6, they knew immediately that the problem was not having the latest version of the software. The upated software solved the issues. The camera seems to work well otherwise, although it should simply come with the telephoto lense to be most useful for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: A good product
Reviews.Author: Eggert Adalsteinsson
Reviews.Content: The Plotwatcher Pro is a good product and it is easy to use, battery live is remarkable, and it seams to tolerate rain, snow and frost well.  The only drawback is that the thermomeater shows ~5°C lower temperature than it is and I can't find any way to fix that.Eggert Adalsteinsson

Reviews.Title: Outstanding game camera for plot watching.
Reviews.Author: Seamus
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind this is NOT a motion-activated camera.  And, it does NOT take photos at night.  It is a programable time-lapse camera.  It has an excellent range, and takes great images.  We've captured lots of beautiful photos of deer, turkeys, and other wildlife on our property, setting it to film from dawn to about 7:00 AM, and 7:00 PM to dark, taking images at 5-second intervals.  WIth lithium batteries, the charge lasted about five months (including several winter months).  Lots of fun reviewing the time-lapse video of your plot, trail, or yard at the end of the week.  Excellent camera!

Reviews.Title: Day 6 Plotwatcher Pro HD Game Surveillance System
Reviews.Author: Jeanette Garner
Reviews.Content: My husband loves this, it shows good quality photos, clear. It is easy to set up & operate, does what it is suppose to do.

Reviews.Title: Day 6 Plotwatcher Pro
Reviews.Author: gary griffith
Reviews.Content: I have now used this camera in the field for over a year now.  This camera will do a great job in watching a large area at daylight hours.  Its field of view and depth of view is great for food plots, or areas around a stand area.  I recommend this item along with the 64SanDisk Extreme 32 GB SDHC Class 10 UHS-1 Flash Memory Card 45MB/s (SDSDX-032G-X46) to install inside for maximum recording time, Weeks!.

Reviews.Title: Good job
Reviews.Author: Jim Ambrose
Reviews.Content: Works well.  Had problems getting it to load on my computer to watch the video.  At first wasn't even sure if it was working.  Called customer support they were very helpful and even called me back to check and see if it was working.  I liked that. Would like the camera to be a little easier to figure out in regards to viewing videos. But it does work well.

Reviews.Title: waiting to use
Reviews.Author: Ed Malkowski
Reviews.Content: I have not used the Plotwatcher in the field yet. I have done some preliminary tests in my backyard and found that it did capture images clearly. All funtions worked properly. I would anticipate that it will do its job in the field

Reviews.Title: Good Product.
Reviews.Author: Johnny Bordes
Reviews.Content: Good product.  If it could take night video it would be awesome.  Works just like it's supposed to and is very helpful in determining where deer are traveling.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: MOO
Reviews.Content: This camera works great. I love to watch the captured pictures. The clarity isn't as good as I had hoped. Xooming the pictures in to get a better look at a deer's head is blurred.

Reviews.Title: Plot Watcher Pro- Big advancement Over Original
Reviews.Author: HuntingKy
Reviews.Content: I had used the original Plotwatcher extensively and liked many of its features but it had a lot of shortcomings: low battery live, it used USB, no way to preview, no way to securely attach it, very little customization and what customization you could do had to be done on your PC.The Plotwatcher Pro measures battery life in weeks instead of days. I usually set it up to take a lot of pictures and I can still get a month or better out of a set of batteries.Instead of taking certified USB drives, this one takes standard SD cards, up to 32GB, cheaper and easier to use.It has a preview screen to help you set it up. Like most cheap LCD displays though, bright sunlight really washes it out so it can be difficult to utilize at times.This one has a place on the back to loop a snake type cable lock through. Much improved but still pretty thin plastic on the loops. I suspect it wouldn't take much to break them loose.It is pretty configurable in the field now, allowing you to set it to take pictures as often as every 2 seconds.Like it's predecessor, it's pictures may be called HD but don't expect great resolution. Further than 30 yards and it is difficult to make out antlers. I don't believe the pictures are quite as sharp as the originals.One additional improvement though is the ability to change out lenses: wide angle and telephoto lenses are available but they are fairly pricey and I haven't had the opportunity to try yet.Over all, I really like this camera and would recommend it be a part of any hunter's equipment.

Reviews.Title: Good daytime camera
Reviews.Author: MNBorn
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Plot Watcher Pro mainly to pattern turkey movement so daytime activity is my primary focus.  I ran a field trial using a 32 MB memory card and 8 AA alkaline batteries.  With images captured every 10 seconds during daylight time the card filled up after 33 days (about 14-15 hours daylight during test period) and the batteries still showed 70% capacity.  The software was easy to install and easy to use.  Resolution when zooming in isn't crisp but is sufficient to make out presence of turkey beards or antlers on deer.  The area I was watching was 40 yards with good results at the far distance.  I recommend this product for watching areas where you are looking for movement patterns during the day, especially if you aren't able to access the camera for several days or weeks at a time.  Great battery life and image capacity.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera yet.
Reviews.Author: James H. Olsen
Reviews.Content: I have had my plotwatcher out now for about a month set up to take pictures from sun up to sun down every 5 seconds. Pictures are great and the batteries are still at 71%. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Tool
Reviews.Author: Northeast Hunter
Reviews.Content: I have had this overlooking a large food plot for over six weeks. A 32g SD card lasts almost three weeks recording from sunrise to sunset. Battery life has been amazing (note that this is during summer weather) after six weeks battery life was still 57%. Don't expect to count the tines on any deer that are out of bow range, but you can see where deer come and go along with the temp. and time of day. I mounted it above the line of sight as it does not need movement to trigger it. Hopefully this will keep it from being spotted and stolen. I might even find out how tree stands mysteriously disappear. I love this thing.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Bbmg
Reviews.Content: We use this video for time lapse home construction! Works beautifully and is simple to use. Batteries last a very long time and is waterproof!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Kei Loc
Reviews.Content: A very well made time lapse camera.  Clear photos. Easy to use software. Batteries last a long long time.  I even set it on a tripod and put it in my car and drove around and the photos were not blurred . Does not work in dark conditions is the only think lacking, but as a daytime surveillance tool, it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Day 6 Plotwatcher Pro HD Game Surveillance System
Reviews.Author: Power Man
Reviews.Content: Great product, easy to use and good picture quality.  I'd recomend this to any one wanting to watch an area or see the change in something.  We used it to see how much movement we have on a steam line when it's cold versus when it's hot.

Reviews.Title: This thing is INSANE
Reviews.Author: hawaiianhooligan
Reviews.Content: I love watching storms, seeing some of the weather systems that passed through the property was pretty impressive. Then the deer showed up.The timer will need some fine tuning to maximize battery/memory life. I can see why some folks had problems with the battery life on the original Plotwatch. I am interested seeing what results I can get from the wide-angle and telephoto lenses that can be added to the Pro unit. I would be hesitant to use it in a public hunting area or close to property lines without any kind of lock box and cable (both of which work very well with thisCamLockBox Security Box for the PlotWatcher PRO unit). There is no flash, and you can hide the unit higher up in trees etc. but I'd rather not take the risk.So far, I couldn't be happier. As far as daytime cameras go, it would be hard to go wrong with the Plotwatch Pro.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: BG
Reviews.Content: The Day 6 Plotwatcher is a good tool to show all game activity.  I have purchased 2 of these units and was amazed to find out how many deer I was missing using a regular trail camera in the same location.  Many times the animals were just not close enough to set off the trail camera but with the plotwatcher all activity during daylight hours were recorded.  Set up was easy and battery life so far so good.  I have had them out now for 4 weeks and have used about 45%-50% of the battery life.  The cameras were set too record from 5am to 8pm, understanding many pictures would not be taken until it was light outside the typical # of pic's per day was 10,752.  Easy to buzz through them and rewind if you find something of interest.  Only downfall I have noticed is that the pic's are blurred when you do try to zoom in which is typical I assume.  Overall very happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Make sure this is what you are looking for.
Reviews.Author: Gary J. Sage "Flyboy"
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera that would be motion activated and shoot videos longer than 60 seconds.  This camera does neither.  It is strictly time lapsed pictures.

Reviews.Title: Plot watcher
Reviews.Author: Jeffery Cummings
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a chance to really put it to the test but I did try the regular plotwatcher and it ate the batteries and always turned off after 3 to 4 days....Very agrivating.....

Reviews.Title: Great tool for finding deer
Reviews.Author: tractor-jd
Reviews.Content: I've used the Pro Plotwatcher in a powerline enviornment over food plots and have had outstanding success finding and taking deer based upon the times provided by my Plotwatcher - I was unaware that deer were in the food plots between 12 noon and 2:00 PM.

Reviews.Title: Best hunting tool for big bucks!
Reviews.Author: nhdeerhunter
Reviews.Content: I have several top of the line game cameras, none of them are as valuable of a tool as plotwatcher pro. After using this one time I realized how amazing it really is. Very easy to set up, software install was a breeze, installation in the field is simple even though i broke the cheap plastic buckle on the stap first time i snugged it to the tree, but the python cable lock works just fine to keep it in place. If you hunt big bucks with a bow, the combination of the pro and trail cams will be leathal! This is for sure to be the reason why I kill my next big buck in the northeast. Can't wait till I can afford to buy more!

Reviews.Title: Why I returned this item
Reviews.Author: Tami Ray
Reviews.Content: Bought for my son for christmas.  He needed something that takes nighttime pictures, this does not.  Had to return. For that reason gave 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Melanie S. Ambrose
Reviews.Content: It won't take photos. I have tried to get support with no help, I am very disappointed. Hopefully I will get this worked out!

Reviews.Title: Poor choice
Reviews.Author: Phil Mulvey
Reviews.Content: I was not careful looking at specs.  I wanted a video and still camera mode for a game trail game finder.  This model only have video.  Not very user friendly and too expensive!

Reviews.Title: very dissapointed
Reviews.Author: andrew voss
Reviews.Content: Purchased this item to use to watch storm clouds with. Opened the product and tried it...was happy with the way it worked and put it away until it was time to use it. set up the camera and it recorded 32 minutes and died. Screen wont come on and it has no power to the thing despite fresh batteries. Checked Amazon return policy, and it says Im past the date for replacement by 2 days even though Ive only used it once....Need to change my thinking on purchases anymore....

Reviews.Title: elephant vs house cat
Reviews.Author: theft victim
Reviews.Content: If all you want to do is tell the difference between an elephant and a house cat then this is your camera. It has about a .4 mega pixel (yes I said point 4). I had it set to take a pic. every 3 seconds all day that is 28,795 pic in on day and it takes about 8 days to fill the 32GB card up. I have recently seen a chart that tells how many pic of a MP it would take to full up a certain sized card. A GB card will hold 64000 pics at 1.3 MP so lets do the math 28,795 pics in a day that is 230,360 in 8 days (that would be almost full). So divide 230,360 by 64000 and we get 3.59 now we divide 1.3 by 3.59 and we get .36MP. So you can tell the difference between an elephant and a house cat if they are more than ten feet away. Everything they say about the camera is true and from what I can tell it is working correctly. The only reason I give a single star is I don't have the option to give zero stars

Reviews.Title: operation.
Reviews.Author: gammabyers
Reviews.Content: Would have gave it five stars but I own two of it's brothers the Plotwatcher Pro and they get the fifth star.

Reviews.Title: misleading capabilities
Reviews.Author: dan p buchanan
Reviews.Content: i am disappointed in both amazon and in the plot watcher product.  FIRST WITH AMAZON.  THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED BY UPS.  I HAD FOLLOWED THE ONLINE SHIPPING SCHEDULE AND WAS LOOKING FOR THE PACKAGE. IT WAS LEFT ON TOP OF MY MAILBOX WHICH IS ON THE STREET AND ABOUT 200 YARDS FROM MY HOUSE.  THE WEATHER WAS INCLEMENT AND THE PACKAGE WAS LEFT AT THE MERCY OF ANYONE PASSING ON THE STREET.  I WAS NOT NOTIFIED THAT THE PACKAGE HAD ARRIVED AND I WAS AVAILABLE FOR ANY NOTIFICATIONPLOTWATCHER WAS FULL OF HYPE ON THE ADVANTAGES OF THEIR PRODUCT. WHAT THEY DIDN'T TELL YOU WAS THAT YOU HAD TO WITHDRAW THE DISK AND TAKE IT TO A COMPUTER IN ORDER TO DETERMINE IF ANY IMAGES HAD BEEN CAPTURED.  WHEN ATTEMPTING TO READ THE DISC ON MY COMPUTER, WHICH IS AN APPLE, THE PROCESS WAS VERY UNFRIENDLY.PART OF MY DISAPPOINTMENT MAY BE THE LEARNING PROCESS BUT I BELIEVE THAT THE PLOTWATCHER COMPANY TO BE GUILTY OF MISADVERTISING THEIR PRODUCT.----DAN

ProductInfo.Features:
HD game camera that takes pictures every 5 to 10 seconds from dawn to dusk
Allows hunters to analyze a potential hunting spot without manually scouting location
2.5-inch LCD for onboard camera setup; captures up to 1 million video images
GameFinder software lets you review files in forward/reverse or scroll frame by frame
1,280 x 720 video resolution; up to 32 GB of SD card storage; supports add-on zoom lens
ProductInfo.Name: Day 6 Plotwatcher Pro HD Game Surveillance System
